snippet: With fair-trade coffee and organic fruit now prolific, consumers concerned with working conditions and environmental issues are demanding more disclosure about what they wear.
abstract: Consumers concerned with working conditions, environmental issues and outsourcing are increasingly demanding more disclosure about where their clothing is made; group of major retailers and apparel companies, including some with history of controversial manufacturing practices overseas, says it is developing an index of how and where goods are produced that will include labor, social and environmental measures.
lead_paragraph: With fair-trade coffee and organic fruit now prolific, consumers concerned with working conditions and environmental issues are demanding more disclosure about what they wear.

headline.seo: Pressed by Consumers, Retailers Are Revealing More
headline.main: Some Retailers Say More About Their Clothing’s Origins
headline.print_headline: Some Retailers Reveal Where And How That T-Shirt Is Made
